file_content.text: Come in, Captain. This is General Garza. I understand you've just docked over Hoth.
Hoth is locked in a three-way resource battle between the Republic, the Sith Empire and a powerful alliance of pirate warlords. It's pure chaos.
I'll be sure to stay on my toes, General.
Understood.
What's so valuable on an ice world?
Why fight over Hoth?
Hoth was the site of a major fleet battle during the first war. Many advanced warships, both Republic and Imperial, crashed on its surface.
Both sides need the material from those ships, and both sides want to learn the secrets of the other. The pirates, of course, see opportunity.
If our people need help, they can count on Havoc Squad's support.
I'll do what I can.
I'm sure any assistance would be deeply appreciated, Captain.
I'll have to keep my eyes open for any ship-mounted weaponry.
Sounds like fun.
I'm sure your new recruit can help you in that regard.
I'm here to recruit a new member for Havoc Squad, not to fight over scraps.
Not my problem.
These are pieces of highly valuable technology--something your new recruit understands quite well.
If Hoth were a nice place, I wouldn't be here, would I?
No surprise there.
Take it as a good sign--your new recruit can clearly take care of himself if he can survive a tour on Hoth.
You're recruiting a technical specialist named Sergeant Yuun. Judging by his service record, he's the finest technician in the entire Republic military.
Yuun is a Gand, an uncommon species in the Republic, and he follows an indigenous shamanistic training. No one understands it, but his results are unmatched.
If he can get the job done, then I'll be glad to have him.
Results are what counts.
Whether through mystical powers or luck, Yuun's gained a reputation from his squad-mates for doing the impossible.
What's a Gand?
Gand?
Gands are insectoid bipeds, native to a planet of the same name. They rarely leave their homeworld, making Yuun doubly exceptional.
Havoc Squad isn't the place for some nutjob shaman.
Sounds like a freak.
Havoc Squad is the place for the best, Captain, and Yuun more than qualifies.
Currently, he's scavenging crashed Imperial warships to piece together a functional Umbra encrypter--the machine responsible for the Empire's most secure military codes.
It's critical that Yuun completes the Umbra encrypter--we've never come close to breaking the code, and the amount of intelligence we could gain is immense.
With Havoc's help, the job will be done in no time.
I'll make it happen.
As long as I see some action.
You'll have to contend with both pirates and Imperial troops in order to locate the Umbra components Yuun needs. Combat is a certainty.
Have you forgotten the massive superweapon we need to destroy?
We have more important goals.
This could give us information to help bring it down--or uncover the next major Imperial threat.
Yuun has already been informed of his transfer into Havoc Squad. I'm told he's excited to meet you.
Contact me again when the mission is concluded and Yuun has completed the Umbra encrypter. Garza out.
